ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: Transform coordinates from a specified source to a specified target map projection. This uses the 'PROJ' library directly, by wrapping the 'PROJ' package (if functional), otherwise the 'proj4' package. The 'reproj()' function is generic, methods may be added to remove the need for an explicit source definition. If 'proj4' is in use 'reproj()' handles the requirement for conversion of angular units where necessary. This is for use primarily to transform generic data formats and direct leverage of the underlying 'PROJ' library. (There are transformations that aren't possible with 'PROJ' and that are provided by the 'GDAL' library, a limitation which users of this package should be aware of.) The 'PROJ' library is available at <https://proj.org/>.

Transform coordinates from a specified source to a specified target map projection. This uses the 'PROJ' library directly, by wrapping the 'PROJ' package (if functional), otherwise the 'proj4' package. The 'reproj()' function is generic, methods may be added to remove the need for an explicit source definition. If 'proj4' is in use 'reproj()' handles the requirement for conversion of angular units where necessary. This is for use primarily to transform generic data formats and direct leverage of the underlying 'PROJ' library. (There are transformations that aren't possible with 'PROJ' and that are provided by the 'GDAL' library, a limitation which users of this package should be aware of.) The 'PROJ' library is available at <https://proj.org/>.

name: r-reproj
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "0.7.0" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-reproj
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/reproj_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/reproj/reproj_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: b2af653fa68df529dfec72a2abbee92ae417ef0c2a83460f0cc657588e4455e4

build:
  number: 2
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-proj >=0.1.6
    - r-crsmeta >=0.3.0
    - r-proj4
    - proj >=4.4.6
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-proj >=0.1.6
    - r-crsmeta >=0.3.0
    - r-proj4
    - proj >=4.4.6

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('reproj')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('reproj')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/hypertidy/reproj/
  license: GPL-3.0-only
  summary: Transform coordinates from a specified source to a specified target map projection. This uses the 'PROJ' library directly, by wrapping the 'PROJ' package (if functional), otherwise the 'proj4' package. The 'reproj()' function is generic, methods may be added to remove the need for an explicit source definition.
    If 'proj4' is in use 'reproj()' handles the requirement for conversion of angular units where necessary. This is for use primarily to transform generic data formats and direct leverage of the underlying 'PROJ' library. (There are transformations that aren't possible with 'PROJ' and that are provided by the 'GDAL' library,
    a limitation which users of this package should be aware of.) The 'PROJ' library is available at <https://proj.org/>.
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-3

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
